performance_tests.purpose: Validate system performance and stability under expected or typical user traffic.
performance_tests.load_level: Normal to slightly above normal load (e.g., 50 virtual users).
performance_tests.example_finding: System maintained sub-2 ms average response and 0% failure rate under 50 VUs.

performance_tests.purpose: Evaluate how performance and resource utilization change as load increases.
performance_tests.load_level: Incrementally increasing load (e.g., 50 â†’ 400 virtual users).
performance_tests.example_finding: System scaled linearly up to 400 VUs with minimal latency increase; slight slowdown observed on /auth endpoint.

performance_tests.purpose: Determine breaking points and recovery behavior when pushed beyond maximum capacity.
performance_tests.load_level: Extreme or abnormal load (e.g., 800+ virtual users).
performance_tests.example_finding: At 800 VUs, 99% of requests succeeded; moderate latency rise and intermittent /auth failures mark the upper stability limit.
